mods.abstract: Weston Fulton, inventor of the Sylphon Bellows, founded Fulton Sylphon in Knoxville in 1904. It manufactured primarily valves and gages, including a thermostat vital to depth charges during World War I and a part crucial to bomb sights during World War II. The company was later sold to Reynolds Metals and then to Robertshaw and Siebe. It also gradually lost its prominence in the field. In 1994, what remained of the business was purchased by Texas leveraged buyout specialist J. Randal Greaves, and its name was changed to Fulton Bellows and Components to reflect its origins. Now known simply as Fulton Bellows LLC and owned by Morris Capital Management Group (which purchased it in August of 2004), the company continues to operate in Knoxville today.
